title.narrative: Equity with Quality and Learning at Secondary (EQUALS)

description.narrative: The Project Development Objective (PDO) is to improve quality of science and mathematics instruction in Community Day Secondary Schools (CDSSs) and increase access to secondary education in selected remote areas.

Ministry of Finance, Economic Planning and Development

condition.narrative: Annual Work Plan and Budget (Schedule 2 Section IB.1). The Recipient shall, not later than April 30 in each Fiscal Year duringProject implementation, prepare, and furnish to the Association, a program of activities proposed for inclusion in the Projectduring the following fiscal year (Annual Work Plan), including: (a) a detailed timetable and budget for the sequencing andimplementation of said activities; and (b) the types of expenditures required for such activities.

Independent Verifier (Schedule 2 Section IC.1). The Recipient shall not later than six (6 months after the Effective Date, recruitthe Independent Verifiers, and thereafter, cooperate with said Independent Verifiers, acting as third-party monitoring andevaluation experts to assess the proper fulfillment of DLIs and DLRs as set forth in Schedule 4 to this Agreement.

Project Support Team (Schedule 2 Section IA.1c). The Recipient shall at all times during Project implementation, maintain withinMoEST a core Project support team comprising: a project manager, a financial management specialist or an accountant, twoprocurement officers (general and civil works), a monitoring and evaluation officer, and an environmental and social safeguardsspecialist, all with terms of reference, qualifications and experience satisfactory to the Association.

Staffing (Schedule 2 Section IA.1b). The Recipient shall not later than thirty (30) days after the Effective Date specificallyappoint, and thereafter maintain adequate technical staff to the following units and directorates in MoEST: DSDE, Directorate ofTeacher Education and Development, and Directorate of Education Planning, and the Monitoring and Evaluation Unit.
The Recipient has updated, adopted and submitted to the Association, the Project Implementation Manual in form and substancesatisfactory to the Association.
the Recipient shall update to incorporate activities financed under the AF, adopt and submit to the Association, the PIM in formand substance satisfactory to the Associationbefore effectiveness.

title.narrative: Primary to secondary transition rate in remote schools from 13 selected districts
% of CDSSs with students using interactive workbooks in math and science
Number of schools expanded or upgraded based on agreed minimum infrastructure package

target.value: 75% of target schools are adequately maintained

title.narrative: Progression rate for disadvantaged students benefiting from scholarships

target.value: 85% of supported students progress to the next grade/form

actual.value: 471 scholarship beneficiaries registered in 2019/20 academic year.

title.narrative: % of public secondary schools conforming to class size range of 45-55 in Form 1 in the 13 selected districts

target.value: 90% of public secondary schools conform to the average class size of 45-55 students in Form 1.

actual.value: Data to be collected in Fev. 2022

title.narrative: Percent of CDSSs with student textbook ratio of 1:1 for maths and science
Percent of CDSS teachers in 43 targeted clusters with good professional, subject and curriculum knowledge in science and math
Percent of CDSS meeting prioritized leadership and management standards

target.value: 50% increase from baseline in the share of CDSSs meet prioritized leadership and management standards

title.narrative: % of CDSSs in 13 remote districts with functional GBV redressal and adolescent hygiene support systems

target.value: 90% of CDSSs in 43 selected clusters have functional GBV redressal and adolescent hygiene support system

title.narrative: Stakeholder satisfaction in delivery of secondary education in the 13 remote districts

actual.value: Baseline to be furnished by September 2020

title.narrative: Complementary streams for delivery of secondary education established

target.value: 7,500 additional students admitted to complementary stream of secondary education in the 13 remote districts

title.narrative: Foundational system for continuous assessment established for maths and biology

target.value: CA foundations established for maths and biology in Forms 3 and 4 integrating 2nd round data. Report and action plan prepared onroll out to other subjects.

title.narrative: Number of interactive Science and Mathematics modules available for use by students

target.value: 100% of modules in the selected science subject for Form 4 developed and or adopted

title.narrative: % of CDSS in the 13 remote districts meeting teacher establishment in Science and Mathematics

target.value: 50% of CDSSs meet Science & Maths teacher establishment requirements defined in STDMS
